Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 13th overall pick, by Northeastern in 1951...
Injured on 8/20/1951 with a Sore Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 4/14/1952 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 3 days...
Injured on 4/21/1952 with a Sore Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 5/17/1953 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for one week...
Had first career hit (double) on 5/2/1958, off Bradley Taylor (MAN)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/6/1958, off Roy Lowry (TOL)...
Injured on 7/28/1961 with a Tender Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Championship with Northeastern in 1962...
Signed as a free agent by Capital City on 2/3/1963 to a 3-year deal worth $802,300 per year...
Injured on 7/25/1965 with a Strained Thigh Muscle, out for one week...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 2/25/1966 to a 1-year deal worth $544,000 per year...
Drafted in 1st round, 24th overall pick, by Gashouse in 1967...
Traded from Gashouse to Longport on 3/2/1967 (Going to LP: CF N. Townes. Going to GHG: LF B. Warren)...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1975, off David Hans (Ash)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/15/1975, off Mickey Tussler (WT)...
Drove in 6 runs against Halifax on 8/22/1978...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Capital City on 4/16/1982...
Drove in 6 runs against Gashouse on 4/27/1982...
